comments:
You must think I do this deliberatly, but don't :) ... just a normal naive, new user! :)

I was trying to -repack all the jars in a directory, and the 
directory happened to be named something.zip (for sort of odd reasons, due to 
another bug, we unzip the jarred up files to a "unique" directory with the same name as the zip file). So ... you could argue maybe I do not even need to do the unzipping first ... but ... we did ... and got the following error to console. 




     [java] Processing /shared/webtools/build-wtp-I/workdir/tmpsite-wtp-wst-I-I200605240303-200605240303.zip
[build-wtp-wst]      [java] java.util.zip.ZipException: Is a directory /shared/webtools/build-wtp-I/workdir/tmpsite-wtp-wst-I-I200605240303-200605240303.zip

Created an attachment (id=42780)
Fix

Yes this is a problem.  We were just checking the extension.  Attached fix is trivial.

I believe this was released as a part of the fix for bug 159028.
Andrew, please confirm.
this has been fixed as indicated in comment #3
